channel.title: Endeavor - Realistic Runescape Emulator - 100% combat, flawless clipping
channel.description:
[center] [URL=http://http://www.rune-server.org/market/virtual-items/selling/507357-mikey-s-services-miscellaneous-server-sided-work-professional-experienced.html][img]http://i.imgur.com/aQH7vIA.png[/img][/URL][URL=http://www.endeavor-ps.com][img]http://i.imgur.com/K9YTiw9.png[/img][/URL][img]http://i.imgur.com/Mj8FDcM.png[/img]
[FONT=Courier][SIZE=5]Open Beta ETA: [COLOR=green]October 15th[/COLOR][/SIZE][/FONT]
[url=http://www.endeavor-ps.com] [size=18pt]Join us today and get ready for beta![/size][/url]
[font=Courier][SIZE=5]Combat[/SIZE]
[SIZE=4]We have the most realistic combat system of any server on the market today. There is sounds for everything, including all weapons and monsters. Our clipping system is flawless and is one of the most realistic there is. You can't shoot over walls, you can't walk on objects, and monsters cannot walk on each other. The bosses are relentless and unforgiving. The combat formulas are fine-tuned and almost exact. If you don't believe us, try it yourself![/SIZE]
[SIZE=5]Mini-games[/SIZE]
[SIZE=4]The mini-games are a thrill and are very exciting. They are put together to ensure the maximum-playability and the highest possible quality of game-play. The mini-game will be synced to the Highscores so you can compete with your fellow friends and players! The current mini-games are: Barrows, Custom Dicing, Duel Arena, Fight Pits, God Wars, The Hunger Games, Pest Control, Fight Pits, and Zombies![/SIZE]
[SIZE=5]Skilling[/SIZE]
[SIZE=4]The skills have been perfected and finely-tuned. Each formula is specific for it's task – to be exact and realistic. Using higher level tools helps the current action you're doing. The skills are: Agility, Cooking, Crafting, Firemaking, Fishing, Fletching, Herblore, Runecrafting, Thieving, and Woodcutting. The skills are twice as hard to train as combat skills – and they are on the Highscores, so get ready for competitive gameplay.[/SIZE]
[SIZE=5]An Interactive World[/SIZE]
[SIZE=4]Endeavor is a realistic emulator in every sense. The world is completely interactive. There are monsters and other characters all over the map – they will all talk to you. Every door and gate will open. You can search through chests, drawers, wardrobes, hay bales, and other things. Music will play all around the map, and all actions have a corresponding sound.[/SIZE]
[SIZE=5]The Community[/SIZE]
[SIZE=4]Endeavor is based on community, we are brought up by it. We listen to our community and we create the content that they enjoy and want to see in the game. The economy is based on players interacting with one another. This creates an exciting environment – when you're in the wilderness you are risking your items. This makes the PvP much more exciting.[/SIZE]
[SIZE=5]The Staff Team[/SIZE]
[SIZE=4]We are nothing without our dedicated staff team and developers. Endeavor has some of the most experienced developers in the community today – collectively over 20 years of experience. We have a professional staff team that is moderated by other senior moderators. This ensures the behavior of our staff is where it needs to be, and that they are treating the position as it should be treated.[/SIZE]
[SIZE=5]We're waiting for you![/SIZE] [SIZE=4] We always welcome new members into the community. There's always a spot for you in Endeavor. So what are you waiting for? Just log in![/SIZE][/font]
[/center] [img]http://i.imgur.com/8vxDU.png[/img]
[ul][li]Based on Runesource (initial release by blakeman)[/li][/ul]
Key:
[ul][li]Not started[/li] [li]Not Completed[/li] [li]Completed[/li][/ul]

[ul][li][img]http://i.imgur.com/PP0Jrcn.png[/img] [size=14pt]Minigames - 45%[/size] [list] [li]Custom dicing game[/li] [li][list] [li]Betting coins[/li] [li]Random outcome[/li] [li]Guaranteed winning (no scamming)[/li] [li]Interactive betting interface[/li] [li]Animated dice on rolling interface[/li] [li]Bet display and model for coins[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Barrows - 15%[/li] [li][list] [li]Digging[/li] [li]Barrows battles[/li] [li]Entering coffin[/li] [li]Chest room[/li] [li]Puzzles[/li] [li]Shaking camera/falling rocks after reward[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Warriors Guild - 25%[/li] [li][list] [li]Animated armour[/li] [li]Token removal for cyclops[/li] [li]Cyclops definitions[/li] [li]Defender dropping[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Duel Arena[/li] [li][list] [li]Every rule working[/li] [li]Staking items[/li] [li]Utilizes every dueling arena, finds an arena based on players dueling in each one[/li] [li]Second staking interface stacks items correctly[/li] [li]Duels can tie[/li] [li]Obstacle arenas and non-obstacle arenas[/li] [li]Checks inventory space to make sure you have space to make a stake[/li] [/list][/li] [li]TzHarr Fight Cave - 85%[/li] [li][list] [li]63 waves[/li] [li]Fight cape reward[/li] [li]Wave saving[/li] [li]Combat definitions for NPCs[/li] [/list][/li] [li]TzHarr Fight Pits - 85%[/li] [li][list] [li]Waiting lobby[/li] [li]Random starting positions (clipped)[/li] [li]Free-for-all[/li] [li]Winner can stay in the arena[/li] [li]Viewing orb[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Pest Control[/li] [li]Castle Wars[/li] [/list][/li][/ul]
[ul][li][img]http://i.imgur.com/iPfCbbI.png[/img] [size=14pt]Music/Sound System - 10%[/size] [list] [li]Music by region[/li] [li]Fading[/li] [li]Weapon sounds[/li] [li]Global sound system, you hear what's happening around you[/li] [li]NPC sounds[/li] [li]Skilling sounds[/li] [li]Misc. sounds[/li] [li]Random sounds (birds chirping, etc)[/li] [/list][/li][/ul]
[ul][li][img]http://i.imgur.com/sf1XqS3.png[/img] [size=14pt]Skills - 90%[/size] [list] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/xLiCOth.png[/img] Prayer - 80%[/li] [li][list] [li]Burying bones[/li] [li]Bones on altar[/li] [li]Prayer bonus effects drain[/li] [/list][/li] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/V6s2clR.png[/img] Thieving- 100%[/li] [li][list] [li]Picking pockets[/li] [li]Thieving stalls[/li] [li]Stunning[/li] [/list][/li] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/7ES6NbH.png[/img] Fishing - 85%[/li] [li][list] [li]Small Net fishing[/li] [li]Rod fishing[/li] [li]Fly fishing[/li] [li]Cage fishing[/li] [li]Big Net fishing[/li] [li]Harpoon fishing[/li] [li]Troll random event[/li] [li]Whirlpool event[/li] [/list][/li] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/nEzDp5E.png[/img] Firemaking - 100%[/li] [li][list] [li]Making fires[/li] [li]Clipped[/li] [li]Can't make on fires on other fires[/li] [/list][/li] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/kzAj9Jn.png[/img] Woodcutting - 80%[/li] [li][list] [li]Cutting trees[/li] [li]Success formula with axes[/li] [li]Adding and removing stumps[/li] [li]Tree spirit random[/li] [li]Crazy tree (?) random[/li] [/list][/li] [/list] [list] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/ajOvng6.png[/img] Herblore - 100%[/li] [li][list] [li]Herb identifying[/li] [li]Mixing unfinished potions[/li] [li]Mixing finished potions[/li] [li]Grinding[/li] [/list][/li] [/list] [list] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/C7TaKfs.png[/img] Cooking - 50%[/li] [li][list] [li]Cooking all fish[/li] [/list][/li] [/list] [list] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/SSGT4fs.png[/img] Runecraft - 75%[/li] [li][list] [li]Crafting runes[/li] [li]Multipliers[/li] [li]Pouches[/li] [/list][/li] [/list] [list] [li][img]http://images.wikia.com/runescape/images/archive/2/28/20110305042814!Mining-icon.png[/img] Mining- 65% [list] [li]Mining all rocks[/li] [li]Success formula with tools [list] [li]Prospecting[/li] [li]Rock golem random[/li] [li]Mining gems[/li] [li]Pickaxe breaking[/li] [/list][/li] [/list][/li] [/list][/li][/ul]
[ul][li][img]http://i.imgur.com/A8IYk4L.png[/img] [size=14pt]Misc.[/size] [list] [li]Following - 100%[/li] [li][list] [li]Default Following[/li] [li][list] [li]Dancing[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Combat Following[/li] [li][list] [li]NPC sizes[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Breadth-first search algorithm for players[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Clipping - 100%[/li] [li][list] [li]Map object clipping[/li] [li]NPC tile clipping (NPCs can't walk on each other)[/li] [li]NPC size support for all clipping[/li] [li]Object validation[/li] [li]Projectile clipping[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Ground Items - 100%[/li] [li][list] [li]Stacking[/li] [li]Global and local[/li] [li]Ownership[/li] [li]Queuing for loading mass ground items at one time[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Banking - 100%[/li] [li][list] [li]Inserting and withdrawing[/li] [li]Swapping and inserting[/li] [li]Noting and un-noting[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Inventory - 100%[/li] [li][list] [li]Adding items[/li] [li]Removing items[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Shopping - 100%[/li] [li][list] [li]Shops re-stock items[/li] [li]General stores slowly remove items they're sold[/li] [li]Updates every open shop when an item is sold/bought/re-stock/un-stocked[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Trading - 100%[/li] [li][list] [li]Exchanging items, declining/accepting trades[/li] [li]Shows items on second screen[/li] [li]Trades should never dupe/lose items[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Clan Chat - 70%[/li] [li][list] [li]Joining, leaving, and talking in clan chats[/li] [li]Join lobby names instead of player's clan chats, first to lobby is the owner[/li] [/list][/li] [/list][/li][/ul] [center][img]http://i.imgur.com/D3aFQw2.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/tOiLr.png[/img]

item.title: Endeavor - Realistic Runescape Emulator - 100% combat, flawless clipping
item.dc:creator: @Mikey_Sasse Mikey Sasse
item.description:
@Mikey_Sasse wrote:

Barrows has been completed and the formula for rewards has been fine-tuned.
More updates to home - adding dungeons and things to do.

gtxWyiM.png712×376


Barrelchest disables your melee protection prayer when he attacks you and drains your prayer by 10-20. He has high defence and will max 35. He drops the Barrelchest anchor.

I’ve added a casket system into the monster drops. The higher the combat level of the monster, the more of a change you’ll get a casket when it dies. There is an easy casket that gives 50k, and a hard casket that gives 100k. This is to help boost the economy in the beginning.

Aggressive monsters are now only aggressive to players who’s combat level is less than or equal to that monsters combat level * 2.

Read full topic
item.source: Endeavor - Realistic Runescape Emulator - 100% combat, flawless clipping

item.title: Endeavor - Realistic Runescape Emulator - 100% combat, flawless clipping
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Mikey Sasse, post:57, topic:528514”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=647268.msg4362518#msg4362518 date=1379029875]
They don’t have to be–if they MOB has been destructed that (in theory) means that everything associated with that specific MOB has also been abandoned, or am I missing something?
[/quote]

They aren’t destructed - they are just not processed in the world tick. The world tick processes random walking, following, combat, and a few other smaller things. Everything else is controlled with ticks, including skill restoring, poison, respawn, etc.

[QUOTE]The idea of warping through everywhere doesn’t really make sense - if you’re talking about a real POV.

Where is the RuneScape Guide talking from? Is he YELLING from the place or is he with the player? Why is the player being teleported to a buncha random places? Why not tell some interesting facts about the area (just as if you are giving facts about a region in the world)?

I also suggest to make the dialogue length perfect. Investigate on the perfect amount of characters required for each line and refer to that.[/QUOTE]

I’ll work on that when I get the time. This is just for open beta, to see how it works out. There’s more urgent things to complete right now.[/quote]
Ah alright man. Just wanted to let ya know.

Read full topic
item.source: Endeavor - Realistic Runescape Emulator - 100% combat, flawless clipping

item.title: Endeavor - Realistic Runescape Emulator - 100% combat, flawless clipping
item.dc:creator: @Mikey_Sasse Mikey Sasse
item.description:
@Mikey_Sasse wrote:

AtomicInt_:

They don’t have to be–if they MOB has been destructed that (in theory) means that everything associated with that specific MOB has also been abandoned, or am I missing something?

They aren’t destructed - they are just not processed in the world tick. The world tick processes random walking, following, combat, and a few other smaller things. Everything else is controlled with ticks, including skill restoring, poison, respawn, etc.

[QUOTE]The idea of warping through everywhere doesn’t really make sense - if you’re talking about a real POV.

Where is the RuneScape Guide talking from? Is he YELLING from the place or is he with the player? Why is the player being teleported to a buncha random places? Why not tell some interesting facts about the area (just as if you are giving facts about a region in the world)?

I also suggest to make the dialogue length perfect. Investigate on the perfect amount of characters required for each line and refer to that.[/QUOTE]

I’ll work on that when I get the time. This is just for open beta, to see how it works out. There’s more urgent things to complete right now.

Read full topic

I also suggest to make the dialogue length perfect. Investigate on the perfect amount of characters required for each line and refer to that.

item.title: Endeavor - Realistic Runescape Emulator - 100% combat, flawless clipping
item.dc:creator: @Mikey_Sasse Mikey Sasse
item.description:
@Mikey_Sasse wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:53, topic:528514”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=647268.msg4362483#msg4362483 date=1379024835]
If so that is a terrible idea and I suggest you revise it.
[/quote]

If player’s realize your system works like this they could use it to their advantage, such as shortening the respawn timer of bosses.[/quote]

Respawn timers and other things that run without player view are handled with a task system. They are not included in the mob processing.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mikey_Sasse wrote:

AtomicInt_:

I figured, but are they removed from the update queue when they have been viewed and the player viewing leaves the area?

If all players viewing the mob have left they will no longer be updated, yes.

item.title: Endeavor - Realistic Runescape Emulator - 100% combat, flawless clipping
item.dc:creator: @Mikey_Sasse Mikey Sasse
item.description:
@Mikey_Sasse wrote:

Do MOB's destruct when all active Player's have left that region? If so that is a terrible idea and I suggest you revise it.

Mobs are processed when viewed by players. They are basically idle if they are not viewed, and are not updated, reset, or included in updating. This does not include owned mobs and mini-game mobs - they are always updated.

Read full topic

The website is being developed - high-scores are nearly done!

Songs on the music tab are now automatically plotted and 99% will play when clicked.
The Hunger Games first map is nearly completed.
Music regions have been updated.

item.title: Endeavor - Realistic Runescape Emulator - 100% combat, flawless clipping
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Mikey Sasse, post:44, topic:528514”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=647268.msg4360221#msg4360221 date=1378579446]
Explain that Treasury Room a bit more man.

EDIT: Plzz share that interface ID for the boats.
[/quote]

There are two keys per map you can get, each to one of the two treasure rooms. Only one player can access any treasure room and only one key can be received per player. The treasure room contains three reward chests and one magic chest. The reward chests have a greater chance of giving valuable items and the magic chest has even more of a chance of giving valuable items. These chests also give more items then regular item searching methods. There is a 45 second limit for how long you can stay inside this room, since no other players can access it.

EDIT: that’s a custom interface[/quote]
Aw damnit.

Read full topic
item.source: Endeavor - Realistic Runescape Emulator - 100% combat, flawless clipping

item.title: Endeavor - Realistic Runescape Emulator - 100% combat, flawless clipping
item.dc:creator: @Mikey_Sasse Mikey Sasse
item.description:
@Mikey_Sasse wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:43, topic:528514”]Explain that Treasury Room a bit more man.

EDIT: Plzz share that interface ID for the boats.[/quote]

There are two keys per map you can get, each to one of the two treasure rooms. Only one player can access any treasure room and only one key can be received per player. The treasure room contains three reward chests and one magic chest. The reward chests have a greater chance of giving valuable items and the magic chest has even more of a chance of giving valuable items. These chests also give more items then regular item searching methods. There is a 45 second limit for how long you can stay inside this room, since no other players can access it.

EDIT: that’s a custom interface
